data.text: #Corruption and #COVID19: the IMF’s latest assessment on why good governance matters now more than ever in our new #IMFBlog https://t.co/S8vmLqjrFd https://t.co/OEmQ4jw2rQ

Young people play a pivotal role in shaping the world's economic future, and the IMF values dialogue on issues that are important to them. Check out our new web page dedicated to the #Youth: https://t.co/6PdvNizERt #IMFYouth

Africa and Asia lead digital financial inclusion. In most countries, digital payments services are evolving into digital lending, as companies accumulate user data and develop new ways to use it for credit worthiness analysis. Read our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/zvvjMpYg7g https://t.co/9dG0jYzipn

The IMF Executive Board approved the first review under the ECF Arrangement for São Tomé and Príncipe and the disbursement of US$4.75 million, including an augmentation of US$2.08 million, to help address the effects of #COVID19. https://t.co/WC09dYWWWV #IMFAfrica https://t.co/W7iMfVelGJ
What is the IMF's Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI)? https://t.co/KIJta9KDxT https://t.co/XjmrYOiDmM
The IMF Executive Board today approved US$4.3 billion to help South Africa address the socio-economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/ZaSgRuFaTP #IMFAfrica https://t.co/VulX33c6V1

Sustaining the fight against #corruption and preventing the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding are essential to ensure that needed assistance reaches the most vulnerable people. https://t.co/qmwPqLnCzg https://t.co/bvbbDVyrPN
What is the IMF's Rapid Credit Facility (RCF) and how does it help countries during the #COVID19 crisis? https://t.co/ffamIuflKC https://t.co/L2Gbh37zdC
People who #WFH are less likely to lose their jobs, but is this a new phenomenon? Read our #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/DBR0pm5tiH #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/IvxkrRxXVa
What economic measures are governments taking to respond to #COVID19? Key actions taken by 193 countries are listed in our updated Policy Tracker: https://t.co/GSeyZRWAxk https://t.co/8WN95QENKa

IMF researchers show that #pandemics progressively widen gap between rich & poor, as measured by the net Gini coefficient (inequality measure). Further, pandemic-related job losses disproportionately harm workers w/ only basic levels of education. https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA #IMFBlog https://t.co/tLLiWU5ukA
A new web page dedicated to the #Youth offers information on the work of the IMF, resources for the youth, and ways to connect with the IMF. Check it out here: https://t.co/6PdvNii3sT #IMFYouth

How do exchange rates impact #trade? Watch the explanation by IMF Chief Economist @GitaGopinath and read her latest #IMFBlog on dominant currencies and exchange rate flexibility. https://t.co/kJelZdTeWI https://t.co/MNtpf30xig

A poll of top economists found that the vast majority felt the #COVID19 pandemic will worsen inequality, in part through its disproportionate impact on low-skilled workers. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA

One size does not fit all: #IMFBlog by @GitaGopinath and Tobias Adrian on how central banks use foreign exchange intervention, capital flow measures and financial regulation to complement interest rates decisions in responding to external shocks. https://t.co/giYYlQW2gw https://t.co/19QaBArVXk

.@KGeorgieva: “Our message to governments is clear: spend whatever it takes, but make sure you keep the receipts. We don’t want accountability and transparency to take a back seat.” Find out how the IMF supports the fight against #corruption. https://t.co/pa5FJfyCv9 https://t.co/VOUvVv3QgK

Sub-Saharan Africa is racing to close the global digital divide. Internet penetration in the region has grown tenfold since the early 2000s, compared with a threefold increase in the rest of the world. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #DigitalAfrica #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/LDAzCMS1Bh

The #COVID19 pandemic threatens to roll back gains in women’s economic opportunities, widening gender gaps that persist despite 30 years of progress. Read our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/sDllkbPWUD #GenderEquality

The IMF is providing emergency financial assistance and debt relief to member countries facing the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. Find out which have so far received emergency financial assistance: https://t.co/lJlAHDqkKl https://t.co/ghMJlBcSDx

The #COVID19 impact is set to wipe out several years of income gains in sub-Saharan Africa. Real per capita GDP in the region is projected to contract by 5.4% in 2020. https://t.co/5p1NODrdhy #IMFAfrica https://t.co/laKVewPX4k

The devastation #COVID19 caused in labor markets could hit women particularly hard and undo gains in gender equality made in recent decades, a new IMF paper shows. More on the #IMFBlog: https://t.co/INQJG5R5Ri https://t.co/8L9kTnFTYt

What if the economy had shock absorbers like your car to prevent major shocks when the economy hits a pothole? And what if those shock absorbers could be installed before the economy runs into trouble? This video explains automatic stabilizers. https://t.co/CFZpOSepNu https://t.co/XTwN4s8fQN
The IMF is fully committed to supporting our member countries, particularly the most vulnerable. Learn more here https://t.co/YjjfFMBey5 #COVID19 https://t.co/OHknGK1nDQ

Participate in our poll ⬇️

How optimistic are you that this crisis provides an opportunity for a green, smart and fair recovery? #COVID19

Professor @paulkrugman joined @imf_podcast to talk about the current crisis and how zombie ideas might hinder the #economicrecovery. Listen here: https://t.co/dwEbBDI1No #COVID19 https://t.co/8Xv3nBdc9y

NEW: Read the latest IMF Research Perspectives newsletter titled "An Economy for All” focused on improving access to economic opportunities. https://t.co/77N0HMUsEi  #globaleconomy #women #youth #financialinclusion #youthemployment #inequality #genderequality https://t.co/FTwx0X8hpS

Thanks to recent reforms, #Jamaica is well placed to fight the economic shock of #COVID19. IMF emergency financing of $520 million will aid in funding the country's health care needs, while fiscal revenue falls from a drop-off in tourism and remittances. https://t.co/gvbJMw32os https://t.co/sNOZ5fPBY0

Growth in #EmergingMarket and developing economies is forecast at –3.0% in 2020, 2 percentage points below the April 2020 #WEO forecast. For low-income developing countries, it is projected at –1.0%, some 1.4 percentage points below April. https://t.co/WpXSzg9YxA https://t.co/0i4tL3Dc2T

Young people play a pivotal role in shaping the world's economic future, and the IMF values dialogue with them on issues that they care about. Check out our new web page dedicated to the #IMFYouth: https://t.co/6PdvNizERt https://t.co/X4ZCJkfwXf

Women who lose jobs due to #COVID19 often have no safety net, because they are more likely to work in the informal sector, with no labor-law protections and no pension and health benefits. Read our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/sDllkbym35 #GenderEquality https://t.co/uE8ugzzq23

Governments today face difficult policy decisions due to #COVID19. Strong economic foundations and technical know-how can help them design and implement necessary policies for a resilient recovery. https://t.co/Ah8mgrUP2a #IMFBlog #IMFCapDev 
@imfcapdev https://t.co/u98i3bSzUu

Our latest research shows that digital finance is associated with higher GDP growth and financial inclusion. It could therefore play an important role in mitigating the economic and social impact of the ongoing #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/BIL0DdPFtn #fintech
REPLAY: Conversation on dominant currencies and exchange rate flexibility. https://t.co/pXIUScf3ZZ

Are rising levels of #debt a serious concern for countries and businesses? #COVID19

The use of the US #dollar and to a much lesser extent the #euro in trade and financing among firms globally could blunt short-term positive impacts of foreign exchange fluctuations in developing economies. Read the latest research in this #IMFblog: https://t.co/XzMwkQO78J

Speed is of the essence in responding to #COVID19, but there is no reason for transparency and accountability to get lost in the process. Like many tourism-dependent countries, #Montenegro has been hit hard from the effects of COVID-19. Read #IMFCountryFocus to find out how Montenegro is combating the impact of COVID-19: https://t.co/p0L77RxSyI

#COVID19 has disrupted tourism and trade, and cut remittances to pacific island countries. Learn more about how the IMF is helping countries weather the crisis. https://t.co/zYc3ucFnX6 #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/j76H4zXNL9

IMF’s Weeks-Brown: You have to fix corruption by addressing the broader governance issues that allow corruption to thrive. That is why the IMF’s Framework for Enhanced Engagement on Governance aims to do this in our engagement with member countries. https://t.co/YsYi4rw4wq https://t.co/O7Oro08G2C

Rapid responses to the #COVID19 should not come at the expense of government’s #transparency & #accountability. Find out how we support the fight against #corruption and aim to prevent the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding. https://t.co/pa5FJfyCv9 https://t.co/bHvex4gt6g

Is there a risk that the #COVID19 crisis will aggravate income #inequality and existing social tensions?

Today's IMF #WeekendRead newsletter has blogs, charts, papers and videos on how best to secure a resilient recovery, the connection between dominant currencies and exchange rates, the COVID-19 gender gap, U.S. unemployment and telework, and more. https://t.co/7mKzXAwswP

A disconnect between financial markets and the real economy has emerged with the #COVID19 pandemic, posing a risk to the recovery should investors’ attitude change and cause a correction. Read more on the #IMFBlog: https://t.co/ABEsjgYcpy #GFSR

IMF’s Adrian: In the field of payments, innovation and experimentation cannot come at the cost of instability. Central banks must oversee the safety and soundness, and the operational resilience, of currency providers. https://t.co/01syHL5Cxn https://t.co/MUCM44yYLF

It’s easier to work at home in Norway and Singapore than in Turkey or Mexico. More than half of houses in emerging countries don’t even have a computer. Amid #COVID19, IMF researchers ranked how ‘teleworkable’ are jobs in different countries. https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK #IMFBlog https://t.co/zz4VL8g7WA

The #COVID19 pandemic threatens to erode economic gains for women. Women are more likely to have jobs requiring face-to-face interaction. For these women, teleworking amid COVID-19 lockdowns is not an option. https://t.co/sDllkbym35 #GenderEquality #IMFGender https://t.co/URTZ6EzAoC

#DevelopingEconomies grappling with #COVID19 could see FX flexibility provide a limited short-term boost for exports, especially with the fall in tourism, given the use of #USdollar and to a much lesser extent the #euro in global trade and financing. https://t.co/SqvfRVl2oS

The IMF Executive Board today approved debt service relief of US$7.6million under the Catastrophe Containment and Relief Trust to help #Burundi deal with the socio-economic effects of #COVID19. https://t.co/21OEWCJaYQ #IMFAfrica https://t.co/d9qbbkq5vm

The use of the #USdollar and to a much lesser extent the #euro in trade & financing among firms globally could blunt short-term positive impacts of #ForeignExchange fluctuations in #developingeconomies. Read the latest research in this #IMFblog: https://t.co/6CTdbW23GG

#ForeignExchange flexibility helps during shocks like #COVID19, but widespread use of the #USdollar and to a much lesser extent the #Euro in trade & financing dampens short-term benefits. Read the latest #IMFblog by Adler, @GitaGopinath & Osorio Buitron: 
https://t.co/gGq2dfHKMC
Food security in #Africa is under threat. #ClimateChange and epidemics are making it worse. On #IMFBlog, we discuss 4 critical things governments can do. https://t.co/3q8xZDUH4g #IMFAfrica
